document.masterDocTitle: Ensign wasps (Hymenoptera: Evanioidea, Evaniidae) in the fauna of Russia, with description of a new Brachygaster Leach species from Tajikistan and Uzbekistan

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Ensign wasps (Hymenoptera: Evanioidea, Evaniidae) in the fauna of Russia, with description of a new Brachygaster Leach species from Tajikistan and Uzbekistan

subSubSection.paragraph: See Deans (2005: 19) for complete taxonomic information.

Material examined.
RUSSIA .
Republic of Karelia
: 1 male , „Sbor Olonetskoy Ekspeditsii“ [= Collection of Olonetsk expedition],
19.VII.1921
(no collector).
Leningradskaya Province
: 1 male , Terioki [= Zelenogorsk],

(no collector); 1 female , 2 males ; Terioki [= Zelenogorsk ] ( F. Morawitz collection); 1 female , Komarovo ,

Distribution . Russia : * EP (N, NW, C, E, NC, CR).—Europe (WE, NE, SE, EE), N Africa, *Abkhazia, * Azerbaijan , * Georgia , Israel , * Kyrgyzstan , * Kazakhstan .

Hosts. Cockroach oothecae of
Blatta orientalis Linnaeus,1758
( Blattidae ),
Blatella germanica (Linnaeus, 1767)
,
Ectobius lapponicus (Linnaeus,1758)
,
E. pallidus (Olivier, 1789)
and
E. panzeri Stephens, 1835
( Ectobiidae ) ( Deans, 2005 ;
Deans et al ., 2012
).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1.
Brachygaster minutus (Olivier, 1791)
(A, C–J, male; B, female). A, B, Habitus, lateral view. C, Antenna, lateral view. D, Head, dorsal view. E, Head, front view. F, Head and mesosoma, lateral view. G, Mesosoma, dorsal view. H, Metasoma, dorsal view. I, Petiole, dorsal view. J, Metasoma, lateral view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Remarks . Two females from Leningradskaya and Nizhny Novgorod Provinces have legs at least partly pale ( Fig 1B ), whereas with most of the studied specimens all legs are predominantly black ( Fig 1A ).
